result.execSummary:
The defendant John Chic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Scanned: State Subpoena.

Defendant John Chic in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant John Chic in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Misd. Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misd.
AS TO COUNT 2 (NEW COUNT ADDED): On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Misd. Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misd.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a pleas of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes pleas to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit of 7 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit of 7 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work. 
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
Defendant to maintain fulltime employment or be enrolled in school. 
The court does not object to probation being transferred to Florida.
DV Surcharge is not ordered.
Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
Court ordered restitution (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $90 payable Megan V. to be taken from bail on deposit.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be taken from bail on deposit (any remaining balance is to be returned to the person who posted it after all court obligations have been meet).
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs (to be taken from bail on deposit).
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant John Chic in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant John Chic in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The defendant has a pending case in Racine and an extradition hold from Florida.  Parties wish to have this trial heard before this court.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 7.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties advise the court this is a firm trial. Due to judicial rotation and at the request of Branch 7, Court vacated the jury trial date of 8/05/15. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 05/12/15 to repay Milwaukee County $100.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 06/01/15.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.   Parties to file motions by 5/26/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant John Chic in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for indigency hearing. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Russell Jones, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $100.00 per month beginning 06/01/2015. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Memorandum from the State Public Defender's Office with attached evaluation forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant John Chic in court.  Nicholas Heitman for Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
